exercises.instructions:
1. Create three `<h3>` components in your index.html file and add any text you want to each.
2. Use JavaScript to attach a click event listener to each one.
3. When the user clicks on any of the components output the content of that one to the Chrome developer console.

1. Filter out elements in the following array that are strings and store them in a new array named `onlyStrings`.
     `const junk = [45, "I", true, null, "am", 3.56, "a", undefined, { catchphrase: "Oh hai, Mark"}, "JS", "rockstar"]`

Hint: You can use the `typeof` operator to determine if something is a string.

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Operators/typeof

1. Create a function that logs the result of adding two numbers

2. Create a second function called `calculate` that takes three arguments: two numbers and a function

3. Execute the second function and make it output `5`
